definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: The manager of produce market told me.
sentences.chinese: 果菜市场的领班告诉我。

sentences.english: Michael Corleone: When Johnny was starting out, he was signed to a personal service contract with a big bandleader .
sentences.chinese: 强尼刚出道时和一个私人乐队领班签了服务合同。

sentences.english: Hello, I'm the foreman of fitter, I'm in charge of this job.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我是铁工领班，我负责这项工作。

sentences.english: They were the line foremen at the giant Wall Street sausage factory.
sentences.chinese: 他们就像华尔街“香肠工厂”的领班。

sentences.english: The headvertisementswaiter was debonair with the guests but firm with the waiters.
sentences.chinese: 领班对来宾温文有礼，但是对侍者却很倔强。

sentences.english: The headwaiter of restaurant ranks the first because of the dark future .
sentences.chinese: 餐厅领班排名第一，因为前景黯淡。

sentences.english: A：I’m a head broker in a large international company.
sentences.chinese: 我在一个很大的国际公司做经纪领班。

sentences.english: Could you leave your suitcase at the Bell Captain's Desk?
sentences.chinese: 请把手提箱寄放在领班服务台好吗？

sentences.english: B：You’d be working with two other head brokers.
sentences.chinese: 你将与另外两个经纪领班一起工作。

sentences.english: Even the foremen or first-level supervisors have a staffing responsibility .
sentences.chinese: 甚至领班或第一线的监督人员也有任用的责任。

sentences.english: At least 1-2 years of experience Floor Supervisor in other hotel establishment.
sentences.chinese: 至少有一至两年在其它酒店当领班的工作经验。

sentences.english: Reports daily to the Team Leader - Stewarding on duty and receives assignments.
sentences.chinese: 每日向当班的餐务部领班汇报工作，并接受任务。

sentences.english: Say, why did the foreman fire you?
sentences.chinese: 喂，领班为什么把你炒了？

sentences.english: The chief of staff is expected to tender his resignation this week.
sentences.chinese: 领班准备这星期提交他的辞职书。

sentences.english: A: I'm a foreman in our assembly shop.
sentences.chinese: 我是我们装配车间的领班。

sentences.english: Our bloody-minded foreman wouldn't give us a tea break.
sentences.chinese: 我们的领班不给我茶休的时间。

definition: abbr. for 侍應生|侍应生[shi4 ying4 sheng1]
odd jobs/servant or army orderly doing odd jobs
assistant manager (in a large enterprise) (Tw)/(literary) to assist
